skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...

security_audit.summary: This is an official skill from a trusted source. A minimal audit found no security issues in the reviewed text files.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to keep updates consistent and clear. This skill provides proven formats and guidance for concise internal communications.
actual_capabilities: Drafts 3P updates with strict Progress, Plans, Problems sections
Creates company newsletters with short, linked bullet points
Produces FAQ question and answer pairs with official sources
Guides general internal messages by audience, purpose, and tone
Provides formatting and prioritization guidance for updates
limitations: Needs user provided facts when tools or sources are unavailable
Does not access Slack, email, or documents without integration
Follows fixed formats that may not fit every company style
Cannot verify confidential details without authoritative inputs

use_cases.title: Weekly 3P update
use_cases.description: Summarize team progress, plans, and problems for leadership in a short weekly report.

use_cases.title: Company newsletter
use_cases.description: Compile a concise company wide newsletter with sections and key links.

use_cases.title: FAQ summary
use_cases.description: Answer common employee questions using official communications and clear language.

prompt_templates.title: Quick 3P update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Mobile team covering last week and next week. Include metrics where possible and keep each section to two sentences.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ roundup
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft five FAQs from recent employee questions about hiring, roadmap, and policy changes. Use the Question and Answer format and note uncertainty.

prompt_templates.title: Company newsletter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a company newsletter for the past month with 20 short bullets, sectioned by themes. Use we language and include placeholder links.

prompt_templates.title: General announcement
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an internal announcement about a new product launch. Ask for target audience, purpose, tone, and formatting before drafting.

output_examples.input: Create a 3P update for the Data Platform team for last week and next week.
output: Progress: Shipped a new data ingestion pipeline, reduced query latency by 18 percent.
Plans: Migrate two high traffic dashboards to the new pipeline and expand monitoring.
Problems: Awaiting access approvals for two data sources needed for migration.

best_practices: Provide the team name, time period, and key metrics up front
Share authoritative links for announcements and policy changes
Keep updates concise and aligned with company tone
anti_patterns: Requesting speculative or unverified company information
Using long narrative paragraphs instead of the required format
Including team specific details in company wide newsletters

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a text based skill and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of the generated updates?
faq.answer: Outputs follow fixed formats and depend on the facts you provide or connect.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slack or email?
faq.answer: It can use those sources only if your environment provides access.

faq.question: How is data safety handled?
faq.answer: It only uses the information you supply and does not fetch data on its own.

faq.question: What if the output feels off?
faq.answer: Provide clearer audience, purpose, tone, and source links for revision.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic writing prompts?
faq.answer: It enforces company ready formats like 3P updates and newsletters.
